info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 5:39PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Rutherford, northeastern Henderson, northwestern Polk and southeastern Buncombe Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 539 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles north of Hendersonville, or near Mountain Home, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hendersonville, Arden, Fletcher, Mountain Home, Laurel Park, Lake Lure, Chimney Rock Village, Chimney Rock State Park, Bat Cave and Asheville Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
